question: Which company has manufactured India’s first driverless metro cars?
explanation:
India’s first state of the art driverless metro cars have been manufactured by BMEL Limited. It has been manufactured at its manufacturing facility at Bangalore and was unveiled by the Union Defence Minister. The unit is made up of stainless-steel body that has a carrying capacity of 2280 passengers.
BMEL has obtained orders for manufacture of 576 such cars for Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA)'s MRS1 project.
